org.spongepowered.api.world.extent

Interface BiomeVolume

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Chunk, Extent, ImmutableBiomeVolume, MutableBiomeVolume, UnmodifiableBiomeVolume, World

    public interface BiomeVolume
    A volume containing biomes that can be at least accessed.

    In vanilla, the y coordinate is always zero.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsBiome(int x, int y, int z)
      Returns true if the biome volume contains a biome at the specified position.
      default boolean containsBiome(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
      Returns true if the biome volume contains a biome at the specified position.
      BiomeType getBiome(int x, int y, int z)
      Gets the BiomeType at the given location.
      default BiomeType getBiome(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
      Gets an object representing the biome at the given position.
      default MutableBiomeVolume getBiomeCopy()
      Returns a mutable copy of the biomes stored in this volume.
      MutableBiomeVolume getBiomeCopy(StorageType type)
      Returns a mutable copy of the biomes stored in this volume.
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBiomeMax()
      Gets the biome location with the highest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector3i).
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBiomeMin()
      Gets the biome location with the lowest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector3i).
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBiomeSize()
      Gets the size of the volume.
      BiomeVolume getBiomeView(DiscreteTransform3 transform)
      Returns a new volume that is viewed through some transformation.
      BiomeVolume getBiomeView(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMin, com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMax)
      Returns a new volume that is the same or smaller than the current volume.
      BiomeVolumeWorker<? extends BiomeVolume> getBiomeWorker()
      Gets a new biome worker for this biome volume.
      ImmutableBiomeVolume getImmutableBiomeCopy()
      Returns an immutable copy of the biomes stored in this volume.
      default BiomeVolume getRelativeBiomeView()
      Returns a new volume that is translated so that getBiomeMin() returns Vector3i.ZERO.
      UnmodifiableBiomeVolume getUnmodifiableBiomeView()
      Returns a new volume that cannot be modified through this view.

    • Method Detail

      • getBiomeMin

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBiomeMin()
        Gets the biome location with the lowest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector3i).
        Returns:
        The lowest biome location

      • getBiomeMax

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBiomeMax()
        Gets the biome location with the highest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector3i).
        Returns:
        The highest biome location.

      • getBiomeSize

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBiomeSize()
        Gets the size of the volume. Defined as getBiomeMax() - getBiomeMin() + (1, 1).
        Returns:
        The size

      • containsBiome

        default boolean containsBiome(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Returns true if the biome volume contains a biome at the specified position. This is defined as {getBiomeMin() <= position <= getBiomeMax()
        Parameters:
        position - The position to check
        Returns:
        Whether or not the position has a biome in this volume

      • containsBiome

        boolean containsBiome(int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
        Returns true if the biome volume contains a biome at the specified position. This is defined as {getBiomeMin() <= (x, y, z) <= getBiomeMax()
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate to check
        y - The Y coordinate to check
        z - The Z coordinate to check
        Returns:
        Whether or not the position has a biome in this volume

      • getBiome

        default BiomeType getBiome(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Gets an object representing the biome at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position
        Returns:
        The biome
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the position is outside of the bounds of the volume

      • getBiome

        BiomeType getBiome(int x,
                   int y,
                   int z)
        Gets the BiomeType at the given location.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        The biome
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the position is outside of the bounds of the volume

      • getBiomeView

        BiomeVolume getBiomeView(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMin,
                         com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMax)
        Returns a new volume that is the same or smaller than the current volume. This does not copy the biomes, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Parameters:
        newMin - The new minimum coordinates in this volume
        newMax - The new maximum coordinates in this volume
        Returns:
        The new volume with the new bounds
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the new minimum and maximum are outside the current volume

      • getBiomeView

        BiomeVolume getBiomeView(DiscreteTransform3 transform)
        Returns a new volume that is viewed through some transformation. This does not copy the biomes, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transformation to be applied
        Returns:
        The new volume with the transform

      • getRelativeBiomeView

        default BiomeVolume getRelativeBiomeView()
        Returns a new volume that is translated so that getBiomeMin() returns Vector3i.ZERO. This does not copy the biomes, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Returns:
        The new volume with its minimum at zero

      • getUnmodifiableBiomeView

        UnmodifiableBiomeVolume getUnmodifiableBiomeView()
        Returns a new volume that cannot be modified through this view. Unlike immutable storage, it can be changed by holders of mutable views. This does not copy the biomes, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Returns:
        The new volume, which cannot be modified

      • getBiomeCopy

        default MutableBiomeVolume getBiomeCopy()
        Returns a mutable copy of the biomes stored in this volume. This uses the default storage type of StorageType.STANDARD.
        Returns:
        A copy of the biomes

      • getBiomeCopy

        MutableBiomeVolume getBiomeCopy(StorageType type)
        Returns a mutable copy of the biomes stored in this volume. This uses the provided storage type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of storage used by the new biomes
        Returns:
        A copy of the biomes

      • getImmutableBiomeCopy

        ImmutableBiomeVolume getImmutableBiomeCopy()
        Returns an immutable copy of the biomes stored in this volume. This uses some internal storage solution that is thread-safe by nature.
        Returns:
        An immutable copy of the biomes

      • getBiomeWorker

        BiomeVolumeWorker<? extends BiomeVolume> getBiomeWorker()
        Gets a new biome worker for this biome volume.
        Returns:
        The biome worker
